I dont think its an issue with installing tensorflow again with pip install tensorflow-gpu because I already did this. In fact, I even created a new conda environment and did a fresh install but I got the same issue

body:
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> print(tf.test.is_gpu_available())
2018-07-02 17:42:04.233407: I T:\src\github\tensorflow\tensorflow\core\common_ru
ntime\gpu\gpu_device.cc:1356] Found device 0 with properties:
name: GeForce GT 530 major: 2 minor: 1 memoryClockRate(GHz): 1.399
pciBusID: 0000:01:00.0
totalMemory: 2.00GiB freeMemory: 1.90GiB
2018-07-02 17:42:04.235408: I T:\src\github\tensorflow\tensorflow\core\common_ru
ntime\gpu\gpu_device.cc:1406] Ignoring visible gpu device (device: 0, name: GeFo
rce GT 530, pci bus id: 0000:01:00.0, compute capability: 2.1) with Cuda compute
 capability 2.1. The minimum required Cuda capability is 3.0.
2018-07-02 17:42:04.236408: I T:\src\github\tensorflow\tensorflow\core\common_ru
ntime\gpu\gpu_device.cc:923] Device interconnect StreamExecutor with strength 1
edge matrix:
2018-07-02 17:42:04.236408: I T:\src\github\tensorflow\tensorflow\core\common_ru
ntime\gpu\gpu_device.cc:929]      0
2018-07-02 17:42:04.237408: I T:\src\github\tensorflow\tensorflow\core\common_ru
ntime\gpu\gpu_device.cc:942] 0:   N
False
>>>


I dont think its an issue with installing tensorflow again with pip install tensorflow-gpu because I already did this. In fact, I even created a new conda environment and did a fresh install but I got the same issue
